other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed multiple cysts ranging from 1 to 4 cm in diameter, leading to a diagnosis of mesenchymal hamartoma of the liver (MHL). The examined specimens identified partly fibrous and focally myxoid mesenchymal stroma with epithelial-lined cysts.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No further cysts have occurred in 13 years of follow-up.

other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed portions of fibrous cystic wall lined by a single layer of cuboidal and attenuated epithelial cells with adjacent normal hepatic parenchyma, findings consistent with MHL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequently, the hepatic cyst regressed substantially, and calcification was noted at 14 years of age.

other_tests.findings: Five nodules in the left thyroid lobe diagnosed as benign nodules.
A 2-cm nodule in the right lobe of the thyroid diagnosed pathologically as follicular adenoma.
